scenario_text.value:
Hmm, what was this mural supposed to be
again?

This mural shows both your world and ours!
Isn’t that right?

And that’s not all! I remember how you told
us that the worlds are actually connected!

And this thing in the middle is a gate.
A doorway that connects the worlds, right?

Yes, though I’ve no idea whether it was the
product of an individual’s unique ability...

...or a widely dispersed skill. Either way,
this gate is likely some lost technology.

And...every now and then it would open for
some reason...

...which led to humans and Kemonogami getting
lost in each other’s worlds.

That must be what this image of humans and
monsters being drawn into the gate is about.

Reminds me of how we suddenly found ourselves
thrown into this world.

No doubt some of the disappearances occurred
because something went wrong with the gate.

So, if it were to open up like this again,
what would happen to the two worlds?

That’s a good question. Perhaps they would
both be plunged into chaos. Or perhaps...

Well, in any case, I suppose all we can do is
pray we never find out.

This world and our world are connected by
some sort of gate.

When that gate opens, humans and Kemonogami
get lost in each other’s worlds.
